intro: Hulsea parryi, commonly known as Parry's hulsea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and plains. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often grayish-green in color. Hulsea parryi is adapted to arid environments and is often found in association with other drought-tolerant flora.
